data.name: WordFinder
data.description:
You will get a string and a index. Find the complete sequence of characters around the index, separated by space and its start index and end index. Return it as a JS object with the properties ```text```, ```start``` and ```end```.

- The index is a integer.
- The index will be within the length of the input string.
- Double spaces may occur.
- There will never be a space at the beginning or end of the input string.
- If the index of the given string is a space, take the following sequence.
- The input will not have any line breaks or tabs.

For example you will get the string

```The quick brown fox jumps, over the lazy dog```

and the index 23.

The result should be 

```
{
  "text": "jumps,",
  "start": 20,
  "end": 26
}
```
